text:

title: Ads in your inbox
text:
After using the Inbox by Gmail app since its inception, I was alarmed to be notified that Inbox would be phased out in early 2019. Inbox told me to download the new Gmail app. Functionally, the new Gmail app is fine; it is aesthetically pleasing, and it incorporates many of Inbox‚Äôs best features. Unfortunately, it has integrated paid ads into your inbox. The ads inflate the already-high number of promotion and ad emails you likely receive, and they are effectively unwanted spam. To make matters worse, there isn‚Äôt a clear way to unsubscribe from them. This seems a clever way to avoid international email spam laws, but it‚Äôs clearly contrary to the spirit of such laws. These ads are unsolicited messages that live in your inbox, even if they aren‚Äôt technically emails. 

So thanks, Google. You‚Äôre killing arguably the best email app available, and funneling users into more unwanted advertisements.

title: Good app but...
text:
Not a bad email app. However it is missing basic features. Such as the ability to select multiple emails at once to move or trash. You have to view each email individually. Which can take forever if you don‚Äôt have the need to check your email every day. Will probably end up going back to another app as a result.

Update: I figured out how to move multiple messages at once. However it took fiddling around with app before I discovered how it works. Still should have the basic functionality right on the main screen to use vs discovering it thru trial and error. But I will give the app a little longer to try out since I eventually figured out how to move multiple emails at once.

title: Good and Bad
text: It‚Äôs good in a lot of ways, but many smaller processes don‚Äôt work too well. Copying‚Äôs annoying, I don‚Äôt like the sliding to delete feature, especially paired with the small bottom bars to undo actions, or notify you otherwise. Make everything a little slower, more precise, more deliberate, and cleaner. Slipshod is not the way to go, I want a legible, open, not accident prone experience. Gmail‚Äôs always cluttered and, frankly, slippery, there are so many actions, an accidental tap or swipe can result in catastrophe, while an imprecise one results in frustration. Make it not so cluttered, not so slippery, more intuitive, sturdier, and clearer. Lot to ask, but you can do it. Also like just get rid of some stuff everywhere, all the random, not widely used things, streamline and facilitate.

title: One Missing Thing!
text:
Love pretty much all aspects of this app, but as much as I want to rate it with a full 5 stars, I‚Äôm only giving 4 due to lack of ability to access files outside of Google docs. Don‚Äôt know how many times I‚Äôve had to switch from phone to computer while composing an email due to not being able to get to iCloud/Files folders. 

Also, for the ‚ÄúRecent attachments‚Äù that do show up, it would be extremely helpful to have a preview feature for those, since there've been numerous times I‚Äôve accidentally sent an outdated file thinking it was the current version, since they‚Äôd have the same name.

These two improvements would be life changing!

title: Glaring security flaw
text: Whenever I open my outlook app, I have to authenticate to read my email. The app locks when you change focus from it. That is how all email apps should be. That is not how gmail works. Because that isn‚Äôt how gmail works, it appears that a hacker impersonating my phone through a sim swap attack was able to read my gmail easily. They used my gmail to reset the password on my outlook account ‚Äî the one that has a properly secured app that they couldn‚Äôt directly access from my phone. I tried talking to a Google representative about this and they insisted that Google engineers are magically aware of all flaws and are constantly fixing them. That happened a year ago and there‚Äôs still no read access authentication on this app.

title: Needs support for searching and applying labels
text:
I love Gmail but as a heavy user for work, I label everything and in many cases have many labels for certain messages. This is how Gmail was supposed to work‚Äîdon‚Äôt delete anything, just tag it with a label and bam, you‚Äôre done. 

The problem is that as time goes on, you need to keep labeling everything to stay organized. On the desktop this is as easy as hitting ‚ÄúL‚Äù for label and then typing the first few letters to bring up the label you need. If you need more than one label, no problem, just rinse and repeat.

On mobile this is not the case. You can bring up the labels, but if you‚Äôre like me and have tens or hundreds, you have to scroll endlessly and you can only choose one. This just doesn‚Äôt work.

So Google, please make your labels work the way they do with Evernote. You call up the label menu and then you have a filter bar. Type the first few letters and select. But the x button in the field to clear the menu and then keep adding tags/labels to your heart‚Äôs content.
